case.name: Caroma Industries Ltd v Technicon Industries Pty Ltd [2008] FCA 1465 (2 October 2008)

fraudulent imitation of a registered design
where alleged infringing design sufficiently different not to be an obvious imitation

whether suspicion that it would be protected under some other form of intellectual property right would suffice. patent

addition to old combination, whether invention of new combination

dictum of taylor j. that "it is right to construe a claim with an eye benevolent to the inventor and with a view to making the invention work"

taking of the substantial idea of the patent with a difference which was not material.

statement of monopoly sought protection for the design as a whole
obviousness or want of subject matter.
no claim of fraudulent imitation. trade practices

whether loss of custom suffered by the respondents after making of unjustified threats by applicant against customer of respondents was suffered "by" conduct of the applicant
whether spray washer imported by respondents obvious or fraudulent imitation of appellants' registered design
respondents' articles manufactured prior to registration
whether such articles could be fraudulent imitations of a subsequently registered design
